intro: Tournefortia longipedicellata, commonly known as the long-stemmed tournefortia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 2–5 meters, characterized by its rough, often hairy stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers, which are followed by elongated, woody fruits containing several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas or disturbed habitats. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
